item.title: Problems with pic
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:14, topic:124436”]I took a minute to search in one of my old java books, And it says that if the image is in the same folder ‘directory’, Use this:

[code]
JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();

ImageIcon pic = new ImageIcon(“example.png”);
panel1.add(new JLabel(pic));
this.add(panel1);
[/code][/quote]
lol… if you didnt notice that is the same this as declaring the JLabel with the pic and then adding it to the JLabel, and then adding it to the pane… lol

also… yea moparisthebest… this topic is resolved tyvm to all who helped!

Read full topic

I took a minute to search in one of my old java books, And it says that if the image is in the same folder ‘directory’, Use this:

JPanel panel1 = new JPanel();

ImageIcon pic = new ImageIcon("example.png");
panel1.add(new JLabel(pic));
this.add(panel1);

item.title: Problems with pic
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

You could always use a null layout if you don’t like a GridLayout. Personally I favor BorderLayout, and I run into no problems using it.

Anyway, I never knew you could add images to JLabels, but here is a proper way of using ImageIcon:

Toolkit tool = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit(); // you don't need more than one loaded in the entire class
ImageIcon myIcon = new ImageIcon(tool.getImage("your_mom.jpg"));

Read full topic

item.title: Problems with pic
item.dc:creator: @pizza_pie pizza pie
item.description:
@pizza_pie wrote:

Hey, for my game, I am having problems. I was going to add my own logo on the bottom but for some reason it doesnt want to show. The logo size is 59 x 17. I used this statement to add the logo:

	ImageIcon logo = new ImageIcon("./logo.jpg");
	JLabel logoB = new JLabel(logo, JLabel.CENTER);

Then I added it with this:

		row4.add(logoB);
		pane.add(row4);

I already have a code like this, it looks like this:

	ImageIcon wel = new ImageIcon("./thing.jpg");
	JLabel text1 = new JLabel(wel, JLabel.RIGHT);

Added with this:

		row1.add(text1);
		pane.add(row1);

Alright, any help is appreciated. Feel free to ask for more information if needed

Read full topic
